dt: {bc}to cause to experience a state of {d_link|self-conscious|self-conscious} distress
{bc}to impair the activity of (a bodily function) or the function of (a bodily part)

pt: {sc}embarrass{/sc} {sc}discomfit{/sc} {sc}abash{/sc} {sc}disconcert{/sc} {sc}rattle{/sc} mean to distress by confusing or confounding. {sc}embarrass{/sc} implies some influence that impedes thought, speech, or action.

pt.t: the question {it}embarrassed{/it} her so much she couldn't answer

pt: {sc}discomfit{/sc} implies a hampering or frustrating accompanied by confusion.
{sc}abash{/sc} presupposes some initial self-confidence that receives a sudden check, producing shyness, shame, or a feeling of inferiority.

pt.t: {it}abashed{/it} by her swift and cutting retort

pt: {sc}disconcert{/sc} implies an upsetting of equanimity or assurance producing uncertainty or hesitancy.

pt.t: {it}disconcerted{/it} by finding so many in attendance

pt: {sc}rattle{/sc} implies an agitation that impairs thought and judgment.

et: French {it}embarrasser{/it}, from Spanish {it}embarazar{/it}, from Portuguese {it}embaraçar{/it}, from {it}em-{/it} (from Latin {it}in-{/it}) + {it}baraça{/it} noose
shortdef: to cause to experience a state of self-conscious distress
to place in doubt, perplexity, or difficulties
